title: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Les Marrons [Chestnuts], for the Service des Objets de Dessert", 1819–20
title_raw: Plate Design:  Les Marrons [Chestnuts], for the Service des Objets de Dessert
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper, mounted on blue-gray paper
inscribed: Inscribed in blue ink on mount, ower center:  Les Marrons
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer Samuels, New York
description: A woman holding a chestnut roaster stands before a large fireplance in a chestnut shop.l   Beside her to the right a little girl protects a young boy from reaching into the fire.  Another woman at left of center foreground is on her knees sorting chestnuts.  To her left in middle ground a man is leaving the shop with an armful of chestnut brances.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Les Marrons [Chestnuts], for the Service des Objets de Dessert", 1819–20. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper, mounted on blue-gray paper. 1989-13-17.
